title: Topic Modeling: Policy Text to Topic Proportions
concept: A full-slide educational diagram in the same visual language as the other figure prompts, but grounded in course-relevant themes: macroeconomics, innovation/AI, climate transition, and health policy. Three-part flow from left to right: topic definitions, one policy-style document with highlighted terms, and resulting topic proportions. The key visual story: one dominant topic clearly emerges (majority share), while secondary topics still contribute.

format.bleed: Full bleed, no borders, no frames

left_panel.what: Four stacked topic cards with top terms and weights

card_style.shape: Sticky-note rectangles with slight bottom wave and clear label strip

center_panel.what: Document stack with top document annotated by topic-colored highlights

document_stack.top_document_title: ECB Brief: Inflation, AI Productivity, and Green Transition
document_stack.body_text: Pseudo-text only, no copyrighted article text

readability_rules.line_spacing: Generous spacing to keep structure legible from a distance
readability_rules.contrast: Dark text on light page background

right_panel.what: Token-level assignments and aggregated topic-proportion bars

assignment_nodes.type: Vertical chain of circular token nodes

flow_lines.from: Highlighted spans in the center document
flow_lines.to: Assignment nodes and mini bar chart
flow_lines.style: Curved arrows, dark gray, medium thickness

dominance_cue.style: Bracket or glow around tallest bar

annotations.secondary_topics_note: Remaining topics still contribute meaningful context.

title.text: Topic Modeling: Policy Text to Topic Proportions

color_palette_summary.note: Use the same muted course palette as other generated visuals.

composition.eye_path: Title -> topic cards -> highlighted policy memo -> assignment nodes -> proportion bars + dominant-topic callout
composition.balance: Center panel dominant, side panels supportive
composition.negative_space: Clear gutters between all three panels
composition.readability: Large labels and high contrast for back-row readability

style_summary.technique: Clean technical infographic, flat fills, crisp edges, minimal effects, clear hierarchy
style_summary.influences: Jay Alammar style pedagogy diagrams + policy brief visual framing
absolutely_avoid: Exact copy of any source figure

output_target.usage: Inserted as a full-slide standalone frame in slides_round1.tex

critical_requirements: Layout MUST clearly read left-to-right: Topics -> Documents -> Topic proportions
Center document stack MUST be the largest visual element
Topics MUST be economics and social-science relevant (not genetics-only framing)
Text MUST be readable from far distance (no tiny pseudo-text)
Topic colors MUST stay consistent across cards, highlights, nodes, and bars
Majority topic MUST be visually obvious via tallest bar + explicit value label
Use the same palette style as the other JSON prompts (muted coral/gold/neutral accents)
Must be readable from the back of a lecture hall
Regeneration only; do not reproduce copyrighted text or marks verbatim
